Description: Cancer at its core is disease of dysregulated cellular metabolism, but how nutrition and the diet influence the metabolic activities of cancer cells as well as other cell types in the tumor microenvironment, such as immune cells is poorly understood. Nutrition is a major environmental factor that influences health, and dietary interventions are commonly used to treat metabolic diseases. This session will explore some of the recent work in the field connecting diet and cancer metabolism and its effects on anti-tumor immune responses that are shedding light on how metabolic pathways in cancer are influenced by nutrients available in the host and tumor microenvironment, potential mechanisms, and therapeutic interventions.
Location: New Orleans Theater B, Convention Center
